title: Kinetic energy and angular momentum of satellite

content.question: The figure above represents satellites S2 and S3 of equal mass orbiting Earth in circles of radii 2Re and 3Re , respectively, where Re is the radius of Earth. How do the kinetic energy and the angular momentum of S3 compare with those of S2?

choices.label: Kinetic Energy Angular Momentum Less for S3, Greater for S3
Kinetic Energy Angular Momentum Greater for S3, Greater for S3
Kinetic Energy Angular Momentum The Same for both The same for both
Kinetic Energy Angular Momentum Less for S3 Less for S3
Kinetic Energy Angular Momentum Greater for S3 Less for S3

content.answer: Kinetic Energy Angular Momentum Less for S3, Greater for S3

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
